means: 脚踏实地的，稳当的，无差错的

sentence.Network_en: Golda was too surefooted to tackle the president head - on .
sentence.Network_cn: 果尔达 却满有把握地不同总统直接打交道.

sentence.Network_en: Surefooted, they leap easily from rock to rock and climb seemingly sheer cliffs.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们脚步稳健, 能轻松地跳跃于岩石间,攀登陡峭的悬崖.

sentence.Network_en: The Surefooted enchantment now requires Fel Iron Rod ( was Runed Eternium Rod ).
sentence.Network_cn: “靴子-稳固”附魔现在需要符文魔铁棒 ( 原来是符文恒金棒 ).

脚踏实地的,踏实的,准没错的  TOPsurefooted 简明英汉词典  DJ: [] 脚踏实地的, 稳当的, 无差错的 TOP 简明英汉词典简明汉英词典高级汉语词典英汉双.
surefooted 稳健的, surefooted 稳当的, surefooted 稳妥的

entry.tran: (人、动物)脚步稳的，不会摔倒的
entry.def: A person or animal that is sure-footed can move easily over steep or uneven ground without falling.

example.ex: My horse is small but wiry and sure-footed.
example.tran: 我的马虽矮小，但精瘦结实，走路稳当。

entry.def: If someone is sure-footed, they are confident in what they are doing.

example.ex: The Labour Party was growing increasingly sure-footed.

means.word_mean: 1. not liable to stumble or fall;
2. not liable to error in judgment or action;

sentences.sentence: "most surefooted of the statesmen who dealt with the depression"- Walter Lippman
"demonstrates a surefooted storytelling talent"- Michiko Kakutani

auth_sentence.content: The crew of three young men were surefooted, in tune with the movement of the boat.
auth_sentence.res_content: The crew of three young men were surefooted, in tune with the movement of the boat.
